website_summaries.verdict: This combo chain saw can be used like a traditional saw, or attached to a pole for an extended 10-foot reach.
pros: 20V battery power, which is compatible with other WORX power tools
High-speed and torque makes fast, clean cuts
Automatic chain lubrication and auto-tension system
cons: Charge provides about 30 minutes of continuous use
Some experience oil leaks and trouble tensioning

customer_reviews.title: Built tough
customer_reviews.text: I love this pole chainsaw. Take my advice and wear grippy gloves when using it. You will be glad you did. Don't expect this saw to go zipping through stuff at high speed. It is made for more power than speed. That means the saw chain moves slower through the cut. Turns out that is a good thing because it affords more control. Since you are essentially using the weight of the saw instead of leverage to cut the slower speed is safer. I would recommend this pole chainsaw to anyone for tree trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Megal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a must have. I made short work of a 50-foot tree that fell at a friend's house. I was a little skeptical at first but after using I prefer this over my gas powered chainsaw. It's lightweight Compact and you never have to fight with it to get it to start. I didn't use the standard battery. I used the worx 6.0 AH MAX Lithium 20 volt battery and got 4 1/2 hours of run time out of it which was more than enough to get each job done. The pole is very easy to attach and gives you a great deal of reach when needed. It's a great light-duty low maintenance chainsaw
customer_reviews.author: MK83

customer_reviews.title: Does Exactly What it Says
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this product. This is not a replacement for a chainsaw. I use it to cut branches and limbs, that I otherwise wouldn’t be able to reach. The battery life is good, and charge time is reasonable. I own several other Worx brand tools, and haven’t encountered any major problems.
customer_reviews.author: DantheMan

customer_reviews.title: Chain keeps falling off, not well built.
customer_reviews.text: I have other Worx equipment which Are pretty good so felt could buy this and leverage the battery pack. Cons - biggest issue was the chain falling off on first use. Used it to cut off branches of small tree and kept falling off. I thought maybe me but my landscape guy had the same issue fixing this and just asked I return it. Pros - - Battery can be leveraged across devices - long pole extension so don’t have to worry about gas and use this for small branch jobs without ladder - battery usually lasts for 30 min on other devices but couldn’t get this working for 30 min without chain falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh R

customer_reviews.title: love other WORX products we have but was very disappointed ...
customer_reviews.text: love other WORX products we have but was very disappointed in this chainsaw. We have a palm tree that needed some limbs trimmed off. Not only was it very heavy to hold it didn't cut like our other chainsaws do it, chewed the limbs not cut
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Very Very lightweight & easy to handle, even when extended to the max.
customer_reviews.text: I’m old school so when I heard the word Battery & Chainsaw in the same sentence I laughed, but with a bad shoulder and no longer able to pull the rope on a Gas Saw I thought I would try this Worxs Chainsaw. To say I was surprised is a UNDER STATEMENT ! Not only is this saw very light to handle but the power is absolutely unbelievable. I have over 75 trees on my property, so this baby has already paid for itself. So light you can carry it with your index finger, so strong you can cut trees much larger than the instructions say to. This saw is a 5 thumbs up. Look at the photos. 👍👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Don’t try and cut too much at once.
customer_reviews.text: Considering it’s an electric chainsaw with a 20v battery this tool works extremely well. If you are cutting anything large then I would suggest getting a more powerful electric saw or a gas powered saw. This tool does what it is supposed to. It cuts up to 3” or 4” branches relatively easy. I wouldn’t suggest cutting anything thicker than that though as the stress and limb tension can cause the blade to get caught. The chain would periodically fall off, but after getting used to the saw and learning how to properly cut, it happened much less. I’m satisfied and it is a nice addition to my lawn tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small one because I've never used a chain saw before. I'm a 63 year old lady and I'm very surprised at how easy it is to handle.
customer_reviews.author: windysoles

customer_reviews.title: Great for light cutting
customer_reviews.text: My days of big gas chainsaw cutting are through, and this small electric model is perfect for those occasional jobs that crop up. I was worried about the power, but the motor is plenty to cut through 4-6” limbs, or even 8” landscape timbers. Takes a bit longer than a gas powered big brother, but the simplicity of use and smaller size is worth it, imho. I have not drained a battery, but I am not sawing for more than an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: D. Walsdorf

customer_reviews.title: WORX IS THE BOMB
customer_reviews.text: Worked amazing on the first try . Cut down all my dead palm tree branches. WORX products are AWESOME. Only thing is make sure you get some Bar & Chain oil because you need to add it to the chainsaw & it is not provided. Otherwise very happy with the product thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Lamm

customer_reviews.title: Came with a bad chain.
customer_reviews.text: I had just bought a jaw saw and was very impressed. Ordered this because I believed it could do things that the jaw saw could not. Everything worked but I wasn't impressed with its cutting as compared to the jaw saw. It just got worse. And after working for about ten minutes on a shrub stump I put the spare chain blade which I had ordered on and in 10 seconds it went through that stump like butter. I want to keep the saw but would like to know what might have been wrong with the first blade.
customer_reviews.author: Panama Bones

customer_reviews.title: Handy! Best thing I bought recently!
customer_reviews.text: I really like being able to use it like a chainsaw and then attach the pole and have a limb saw. It is very easy to change and although lightweight (compared to a gas saw) it is well made. The battery that comes with it has about the life you would expect and you will get tired and run out of battery about the same time. I purchased an extra battery that is a little stronger and holds a charge longer. It can go longer than I can!
customer_reviews.author: George W. Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Works very well but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tree limb trimmer / chainsaw combo. It works well, and has decent battery life (using a larger amperage hour battery). It is basically a chainsaw on a pole, so it is heavy to more around and lift into position to cut limbs. It is very good quality - compared to other ones (2 others) I have owned over the past couple of decades that broke in some way after minimal use. This is basically a chainsaw on a stick. It does have good quality in its build. Just heavy to use compared to other models.
customer_reviews.author: Helomech

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: I have about one and a half acres of pine tree and have been trimming them for two weeks. I have put this saw through more than it was designed for and it is still running like the day I got it. It is very well made and sturdy. Only negative is it's a little heavy when fully extended. Other than that, an awesome product. My son in law is an arborist and I might get him one as a tree climbing saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: This is a handy addition to any tool box!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this battery powered chain saw to assist in maintaining my wood lot, selectively girdling unwanted trees to free up more desirable species. I also used it for clearing small saplings and overhead limbs which inhibited passage ways. It is easy to use and very convenient and available for immediate use without the normal effort of starting a gas powered chain saw. The light weight is a plus, but even with that it is still somewhat hard to maneuver when the pole is fully extended. So far the battery life has been ok, but a second battery would be a nice addition. I would recommend this saw for light chain saw work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value and versatility!
customer_reviews.text: I know what you're thinking, "an electric chainsaw....what could that little thing possible cut besides twigs" but this little saw gives you a lot of power for it's size and weight (see picture). The versatility of this saw for the value is awesome! The extension pole is super useful for landscape maintenance. The battery lasts a lot longer than I expected even when cutting larger logs, but you'll want a spare just for peace of mind. It's awesome to bring along for trail maintenance because of how light it is. Great saw, at a great value, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: neil barner

customer_reviews.title: Good for light Backyard DIYer.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job cutting but needs a counterweight so the end doesn’t fall so hard after cutting through the limb. Bought it because I already had a 20 volt Worx multi-drill and needed a new charger as well. Battery is decent for the backyard for a light DIYer but if you want to have a beefy limber that can do some serious work on acreage suggest stepping up to more power, larger battery and quick recharge or gas powered.
customer_reviews.author: Ironman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Leaks a little oil, but all of my chainsaws have done that. This little thing works very well, especially when you consider it only has 20v of juice. Using the higher amperage Worx batteries would make it even more of a standout performer. The extendable pole is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moo

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims, great from trimming
customer_reviews.text: Chain adjuster backs off easily, other than that did what it need to do, saved me 200.00 by doing it myself after buying. So easy a carpenter girl could use it.
customer_reviews.author: wendy Rial

customer_reviews.title: Beast in Disguise
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have tool for any homeowner. I own several gas powered heavier duty chainsaws and I will grab this one first if I need to cut anything small than my leg. I own several acres of wood and use this saw to get rid of the smaller trees or limb branches off bigger trees. You MIGHT Get a solid 30 minutes out of this before the battery starts to die. I will probably buy another. This thing is a beast in disguise.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Worrell

customer_reviews.title: Was it used???
customer_reviews.text: The assembled unit was a nice one. 4 things of concern are: 1) my saw "appeared" to be used!?! There were wood shavings in the box and the oil reservoir had remnants of oil.? Also, there was "Blue Painters Tape" holding the pole in place in the box, 2) IT WAS HEAVY!!, 3) when I added the larger long life battery ...it got even heavier!, 4) the saw blade was dull. It "chewed" the limb rather than "cut" the limb Overall, it was a good unit but I did not get to fully evaluate it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well, a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: This gets the job done. I like that I can detach the electric chain saw from the pole and use it separately. More convenient than using a two stroke gas chain saw since I only occasionally need to use one. The chain saw feels heavy when it's at the end of the pole, and if I extend the pole all the way the chain saw is too heavy at such a long distance away for me to use. If you're more fit than I, maybe no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Unit was frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: After reading instruction booklet, battery charged, we were ready to use this chain saw by itself first. This was the first cordless chainsaw purchased. Unfortunately, the chain kept coming off the saw. Not once, not twice, but three times. We spent more time replacing chain on saw than accomplishing anything. My husband eventually used his corded chainsaw. Never tried the pole extension. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Check the chain!
customer_reviews.text: At first it was not cutting, just scratching the wood. I looked it over and discovered that the chain had been installed backwards. Fortunately there's a nice picture and arrow on the bar and it was easy to tell what the problem was and correct it. Now it works quite well. I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Great chain saw
customer_reviews.text: This electric chain saw is perfect for my home needs. The battery life is good and I have an electric edger by the same company I have enough battery power for my needs. I only have small fallen limbs and branches to clean up so this chain saw works great for these projects. I like the auto oiler and chain tensioner which makes using the saw very easy. Very pleased with the electric chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: EA Poe

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to use, pole saw or standalone works both ways. Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I use it for tree trimming and arborist work. Sure it’s not long like a Dwalt but the fact that it’s a pole saw and a stand alone saw makes it much more worth it. I would recommend highly getting a 4ah battery the thing lasts almost forever. It’s also quiet. The only con with this is you have to store it a certain way or the oil leaks out. Other than that I enjoy its lightness and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Dania

customer_reviews.title: Its a Beast!
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything! Disliked nothing! I have COPD with only 34 percent lung capacity and get winded trying to pull start my gas powered chainsaw. This made life so much easier for me and I thank WORX. I hate feeling limited to what I can do and with this tool I don't. It cut through limbs and took down this tree with no problem and used one battery. Diameter ranged from 1 to 4 inch and the trunk was 6 inches in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: This saw will cut a tree down
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw itself works awesome. It is strong enough to cut a log in half. The battery lasts a very very long time. The extension is a little awkward and heavy but it does a good job too! I use the battery on my worx Blower and weed wacker as the battery lasts longer then the ones they came with.
customer_reviews.author: Viperwife

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cordless chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: WORX has a nice product in this cordless pole chainsaw. The handle is long and adjustable. The chain saw comes off and works easily without the pole also. Enjoyed trimming the trees with this. Battery life cut a bunch of large tree limbs without hesitation. Battery charges fast and last a long time. no issues with this product
customer_reviews.author: Lisa90540i

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Followed all the instructions. The chain kept on getting derailed. no matter what adjustment I do, it kept on derailing. I'm very disappointed with this product. I have other Worx tools and they are good but not this one. Amazon was so graceful that I was able to return this back. Thanks Luis (customer service)!!!
customer_reviews.author: Boyet Yumul

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Cant review battery life,, never made it that far. This saw keeps kicking the chain off the bar after just less than 5 minutes of use. Small limbs only. Adjusted to specs and chain will still not stay on. Very difficult to put it back on. Spent more time fixing the saw than cutting. I'm used to gas saws and have quite a bit of experience with chainsaws, wanted low maintenance, occasional use electric model. This isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: When you put the saw on the pole very heavy and hard to control. I'm in my 70's but a young man could use it on the pole with ease. That's why I gave it a three for the light weight. That is why I bought one you take can take the saw off the pole. I have several Worx products and they all work as they should. Very good products.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy & cumbersome, as a pole saw
customer_reviews.text: As a pole saw it's too heavy and cumbersome to use. Tried to use it fully extended and stopped immediately. Perhaps it performs better as simply a chain saw. Also, the 'folding' pole is cumbersome and difficult to store. Cannot and will not use as a 'pole saw'. Will keep it as a simple chain saw rather than returning it.
customer_reviews.author: why me - victor

customer_reviews.title: Good buy very too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job on some very high thick branches. It is extremely top heavy so you need good upper body strength which I do. The pole does wobble a lot at full extention due to the weight of the saw so hitting the right spot to cut might take a few tries. Overall, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JAP73

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: You really need the 4 AH battery unless you’re only trimming 1 or 2 branches. Also, the slightly heavier 4 AH battery improved the balance during use. As with all chain saws the saw chain will stretch each time you begin to use it due to friction/heat. Stop cutting and manually adjust the tension. No tools are necessary, and it only takes a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery and no way to replace just the battery
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to try this product because the battery is not charging. I just want to replace the battery but there is no way to leave a request for that. It looks like I have to replace the whole item if I want to get a battery works! This makes no sense. I am hoping someone who can make a difference will see this review and help me get a replacement battery.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Wells

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for a battery powered saw.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for a battery powered saw! Very light weight, easy to use from a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: danny sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband after watching him struggle with a manual saw to cut branches high up in a tree. He has shoulder issues and when I found this I thought its worth a try. Well he loves it. Its light weight and powerful enough to do all he needs to do. I bought the set that came with an extra battery which gives you plenty of time to cut. The fact that the saw can be detached and used as a regular chain saw is a bonus. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PV

customer_reviews.title: Good saw with surprisingly long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: This saw exceeded my expectations. I used it to prune limbs of up to 4 inches in diameter that were up to 15 feet off the ground. It has very good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: TWG

customer_reviews.title: not for women
customer_reviews.text: Just too cumbersome. We returned it because it was just wasn't user friendly in any way. We felt the design was lacking. We bought it because their blower was great and we wanted to share batteries. Bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: sendcash

customer_reviews.title: Better than gas powered chain saws!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best chain saw! Yes, much better than a gas powered one because it’s just as good and much easier to use. It cut so good. It’s easy to use and light weight. I cut through 7 inch trees just as easily as a gas powered one, just a little slower. The battery lasts a long time. I have 3 worx battery powered tools and can not imagine going back to gas powered.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We previously purchased a similar pole/chain saw from another supposed brand name. After the warranty was out it went out also. We were not able to purchase a replacement part. Big difference in the WORX brand. We haven't had any problems and found this one has more power. Great!!
customer_reviews.author: Ceci Harper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pole saw!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever!!!! Got to cut some branches in our back yard, the battery lasted a long time and the chain is still sharp. We used it to cut limbs down on my parents farm and the battery lasted a long time. Very pleased with the unit!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Got this for car camping firewood, cause there’s always a fallen tree somewhere near the campground! I get about 8-10 full cuts on an 8” tree with the 2Ah battery. Just get extra batteries and don’t worry about it. High quality, simple, easy to use. Pole extension works super well!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with the WorkX chainsaw and pole!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the ease and efficiency of the chainsaw and pole. Good instructions - which I found very useful being a newbee at cutting off tree limbs and downing trees. This has worked great for me -
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great small Chain saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small chain saw. It is really more like a heavy duty trimmer. It's not as powerful as a chain saw but if you have small limbs that are too big for a hand saw to you don't need a big chain saw this is your guy. Husband loves it for trimming up low branches and cutting down small trees.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tefft

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, Lightweight and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I caretake acreage. I have over 50 trees of Oak and Mesquite. This saw performs well for my needs. On my 1st use, I was disappointed. On the second day, I discovered it to be a tool I liked using and have been using at least twice a day for two weeks. I haven't used my gas chainsaws since purchasing this item. I would recommend and would purchase again if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Morris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me ....
customer_reviews.text: This saw does a great job for the trimming jobs I am doing around the yard, which is completely surrounded by woods. Cuts through 3"-4" limbs without much trouble. Battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good light duty pole chain saw - works well
customer_reviews.text: I used it to trim several low hanging limbs on our mature trees. It worked well, and I was able to cut all that needed it. It is a bit heavy when fully extended, but the weight allowed it to cut well.
customer_reviews.author: H G Chamberlain III

customer_reviews.title: Not gas or electric.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it's a battery pole saw. I have a gas chain saw and it takes for ever to start and keep it running. Plus, I have a Worx grass trimmer that has lasted over 5 years, great company.
customer_reviews.author: kp

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! A little heavy but it gets the job done. Powerful little saw! I purchased a larger, longer lasting battery. I really like this product! I would recommend purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Dual purpose , powerful, and one of the lightest pole saws available.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, very powerful with long reach and light weight. The chainsaw is removable and can be used as a standard 10" chainsaw, which lets this tool serve two purposes ! It is very powerful, and I have used it to take down 10-12" diameter trees with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worx is the best
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and light weight for a 65 year old woman. Love it. Just what I needed to do my yard work without any help from others. It's the best. I have other Worx tools and love their products.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: check the chain frequently to make sure it is tight.
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw, good for small branches. I have another Worx product, a grass trimmer that is great and I can interchange the batteries when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: CRbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Chainsaw on a pole--who could ask for anything more?
customer_reviews.text: I have a manual pole saw which works for small branches and twigs. But once the branches get too big to cut by pulling on the rope, it is time to pull out the chainsaw on a pole. It works perfectly for those branches that are too big to cut with the manual saw.
customer_reviews.author: sb13

customer_reviews.title: FIRST ELECTRIC SAW...BETTER THAN EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: with a gas powered saw you allow the saw to do the work,,,,with this electric saw you really must let the saw do the work because of the low rpm. cut great for what it is. certainly a little heavy ...59 years old and in good condition. needed a break every 10 minutes or so from the over head weight . would have given 5 stars if not for that but i imagine that is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool every gardener should have.
customer_reviews.text: Great combination of a 10” chain saw blade with a long extension. As can be separated from the extension pole and use it as a handy chain saw to trim limbs and even small logs. When the saw is attached, it’s a bit heavy but still effective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a great pole saw
customer_reviews.text: The chain saw itself makes it very top-heavy and hard to use. As a small limb size chainsaw it works pretty well. We had issues with the chain wanting to come off but I think we adjusted it to make it easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have been beating this thing to death. Getting it stuck under the weight of limbs from improper cutting and just yanking it out. Jamming it from weeds going in while cutting bamboo at the base. Knocking the chain off from cramming it into a hedge line, cutting palm tree limbs etc. I figured I would just abuse it til it died. It doesn’t die!

customer_reviews.title: Love all my Worx  products !
customer_reviews.text: I have three Worx products. My batteries are all interchangeable so but the pole saw was a given. It is made well and works great. Love the fact the mini chainsaw is detachable. So handy. Easy to operate and built well. Their customer service is great to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORX is a high quality battery powered company
customer_reviews.text: can't go wrong this chainsaw finished off my complete WORX set, and for home-owner type stuff nothing can beat their convienence... No more nasty fuel spills and heavy chainsaws oh and its a lot more quiet which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R

customer_reviews.title: Worx pole chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Worx model 10” chainsaw for the flexibility of using the saw attached to the pole or separate. A major wind storm hit our neighborhood 2 weeks after purchasing the saw and knocked down several 6-10” diameter trees. This Worx model proved to be a workhorse cutting through the tree limbs and branches. Our small generator was used to charge extra battery packs we had from our Worx weedwacker. The batteries are the same. Wonderful products.
customer_reviews.author: George Gehrke

customer_reviews.title: With this thing I’m ready to cut down the forest
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how easy it was to chop down branches. I had a similar product a few years ago but this thing could probably chop down a tree. It’s a bit expensive. That is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus O'Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Worx Pole Saw is great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Battery lasts longer than expected. As others have noted it is heavy to wield with pole extended. A bit of an upper body workout but am very happy with the pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Robear

customer_reviews.title: This saw is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Its powerful, easy to use, battery life is good but I did buy an extra battery. We have been doing a lot of work with this saw. Its a quality product and I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: This unit is a tough cutter and works great. Not fast but cuts limbs well.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is decent. Easy to extend the pole to cut higher branches. It's not a fast cutter but does a good job. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: bought it to trim some higher branches, have several other worx tools... great... light weight but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: mucca

customer_reviews.title: lesson learned
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed to find out 10 lbs, not extended, turns into ? 60 lbs, when trying to cut a limb of a tree.
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Great Price / Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Great price but must adjust tension after each cut or chain will come off. “Auto tensioner” is a joke. Best thing to say is you get what you pay for. Good tool if you have just a few trees to trim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if your strong enough to hold it while extended
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good but its not for everyone, it's really heavy once you put the extension on
customer_reviews.author: juvenal

customer_reviews.title: Great for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, but I've been using it as well as our son. It's so much easier than using a regular chainsaw. Nothing to fill or oil... just put the battery in and press the button. Works great and has a whole lot of power for a battery powered tool. Have been clearing some small trees and lots of branches. The price was amazing too.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: This was wonderful to help clean up an overgrown small tree. I had no problem putting it together and using it. Very, very please with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Peg A Holton

customer_reviews.title: Look for another pole chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: Battery life isn't bad. Leaks oil like crazy. The casing for the actual chain has too much spacing so while cutting pieces of tree get in and jam the saw up. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: cld1119

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong the Worx
customer_reviews.text: My eighth Worx tool love them all haven't used yet love the shared batteries. Positive I will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry H.

customer_reviews.title: Oil leaks
customer_reviews.text: After one first use, oil leaks and have to add oil every time I need to use it. Will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan J

customer_reviews.title: Battery will not charge
customer_reviews.text: Cannot charge the battery so saw is no use until new battery is shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Very good quality. The chain is sharp and cuts very well. I was able to take down several tree limbs in just a few minutes. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for the saw attachment only
customer_reviews.text: All the weight is at the end, so if you need to cut anything more than a couple feet outside your reach, it gets very awkward. That said, the saw itself is very good and cuts surprisingly well. Battery life is not at all good, though. With the bigger battery I think it would do very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Really like this saw. Easy to put together, cuts great, and battery is better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: DUDE

customer_reviews.title: Get bigger battery
customer_reviews.text: Saw is great. Battery life is ok but upgrade to 4amph battery as one shipped with saw does not last. Saw on end of pole is a bit of a workout but great for trimming up trees.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well!
customer_reviews.text: For the $$ and ease of purchase it’s a very good item. It is rather unbalanced to control with most of the weight at the far end but works well and is great for around the home clean up, just be prepared that it is a bit difficult to control when extended...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good product.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Work right on trimming palm trees. We'll see how it does on the Oaks. Check it out thoroughly before you use it because some of the parts were loose.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Miller

customer_reviews.title: Makes 10 minute jobs take 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: chain flipped off too easily at pinch, no problem re racking and continue on.
customer_reviews.author: chipster

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little saw.
customer_reviews.text: With a fresh battery it will cut for 20 to 30 minutes. Love the fact you can use it detached from the pole. Had a friend of the family help me cutting last weekend who used to work for a tree cutting service, he said that he should pick one of these up.
customer_reviews.author: M. RISING

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery.
customer_reviews.text: It works great, batt. Last long. It does leake oil so you have to watch where you store it.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Surrell.

customer_reviews.title: Leaky oil reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Quite heavy for trimming high branches but cut easily as a stand alone chainsaw. Used twice and put it on shelf to find that the oil reservoir leaked all over the shelf. It was completely empty and I am past the he return window. Gave it a one star for short return window and leaky reservoir
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kilawee

customer_reviews.title: Good power
customer_reviews.text: It is lighter than a regular chainsaw and has good power.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Saul work great. It is exactly what I needed. However, it has a slow leak in the oil reservoir and the auto adjusting chain is s
customer_reviews.text: The Saw works great. It is exactly what I needed. However, it has a slow leak in the oil reservoir and the auto adjusting chain is something I haven’t quite figured out yet as it needs adjusting every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Not-as-old-as-I-look

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for your buck. Maybe even a little more powerful than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: Saw with pole attached is heavy and difficult to use. Basically take 2 people
customer_reviews.text: The chain saw is easy to use on small branches of dried or dead wood. I was not strong enough to use the saw with the pole attached. It is top heavy and difficult to balance. It did work well with 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: powerful
customer_reviews.text: has a lot of power and was able to remove several larger branches. Would be better if the saw was able to tilt forward some so you can cut from the top down
customer_reviews.author: hayfarmer

customer_reviews.title: Good Battery Chainsaw But Leaks Bar Oil
customer_reviews.text: Good for light cutting around the yard. The only main concern is that it leaks bar oil no matter which position I place it.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Very weak battery
customer_reviews.text: Saw is very heavy, dangerous if you want to cut high branches. Battery is very weak. Stopped after 6 minutes and have to recharge battery. Good idea for dry short tree so u do not have to extend the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Sam E.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome saw used it already without the pole and it is amazing. Perfect for home use. Light strong and just a perfect saw for home owners.
customer_reviews.author: PurpleDuck

customer_reviews.title: 2 in one!
customer_reviews.text: The electric chainsaw works great on its own for decent size trees/logs ( I’ve tried up to 8 inches thick so far without issues). Attaching the pole is a piece of cake and now you can reach hard to reach branches no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Gave it a pretty good workout. Gets heavy if there are lots of limbs at the farthest reach, but got the job done well.
customer_reviews.author: Buford

customer_reviews.title: Good little saw
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this saw. It has done the job without too much trouble. I did have some problem getting the chain tight enough to not slip off but I think that is solved. It did what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: joe lalla

customer_reviews.title: pole saw
customer_reviews.text: worked great. I used it to trim up all the trees in my yard
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Lynn Lambe

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for the money,long battery life,but a little top heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hixson

customer_reviews.title: Nice small handsaw without pole
customer_reviews.text: The detachable saw is nice when the pole isn’t needed. The saw was a little heavy on the end of the pole for this strong lady.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

product_meta.title: Worx WG323 20V Power Share Cordless 10-inch  Pole Saw/Chainsaw with Auto-Tension
product_meta.description: Style:20V 10" Cordless Pole/Chain SawWord 20V 10 Inches Cordless Pole/Chain Saw With Auto-Tension 20 V DC - Battery Powered Cordless 20V Power Share chain saw for fast clean cuts Tool-less pole extension with a maximum 12 inches reach Automatic, tool-free chain tension system Automatic chain lubrication with oil level indicator Compact and light weight design Includes an indicator system for quick battery life review
feature_bullets: [12 Inches EXTRA REACH] It takes just a few minutes, and no tools to attach the pole; And with a reach of up to 12 inches, and at only 10 lbs you’ll be able to get to branches and limbs before they become a problem
[FAST, CLEAN CUTS] This cordless 20V Power Share chain saw is as fast and powerful as anything in its class; And with no gas, and no cord, there’s much less muss and fuss
[AUTOCHAIN TENSION] The automatic, toolfree chain tension system ensures you’ll always have the correct tension for the job at hand

[AUTOCHAIN LUBRICATION] The automatic chain lubrication system not only makes for smoother, more efficient cuts, but it extends the life of the tool; And the oil level indicator lets you know exactly where you stand
[COMPACT, LIGHTWEIGHT] The saw itself weighs only 6.2 lbs, about as much as a 2Liter bottle of soda; You’ll work longer, with less strain on your hands, arms, back, and legs

[PLENTY OF JUICE] These are the same batteries we use on our JawSaw and in our lawnmowers and for our HydroShot power washer; They’re powerful enough for those tools, and powerful enough for a chainsaw
[DO IT ALL WITH ONE BATTERY] The battery that comes with this tool can be used on any of the 20V power or garden tools in the WORX Power Share platform

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars439 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
